description: Numbers n such that 10*11^n -1 is prime.
references: R. K. Guy, Unsolved Problems in Theory of Numbers, Section A3.
links: H. C. Williams, The primality of certain integers of the form 2Ar^n - 1, Acta Arith. 39 (1981), 7-17.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
extensions: One more term from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 16 2003
